brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective randomized controlled multicenter study to evaluate non-operative treatment
      protocols for treating ER-stress negative unimalleolar Weber-B type fibular fractures.
      Groups are: 1. 3 weeks in a removable splint 2. 3 weeks in a cast and 3. 6 weeks in a cast.
      Follow-up visits at 3, 6 and 12 weeks and after 1 and 2 years after injury. In each time
      X-rays laterally and mortise projections. Guestionnaires: RAND-36, VAS, Olerud-Molander and
      FAOS in follow up-visits 6 and 12 weeks and 1 and 2 year.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Different Non-operative Treatment Protocols of ER-stress Negative Weber-B Unimalleolar Ankle Fractures. A Multicenter Trial
clinical_study.condition: ER-stress-test Negative Unimalleolar Fibula Weber-B Fractures

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Stable Weber-B type fibula fracture

          -  ER-stress negative

          -  16 or over years old

          -  Willingness to participate on study proved by a signature and date

          -  Walking without aid before accident

          -  Treatment started within 7 days from injury

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Prior ankle fracture or significant fracture in the area of ankle or leg

          -  Bilateral ankle fracture

          -  Pathological fracture

          -  Diabetes mellitus or an other significant periferial neuropathy

          -  municipality of Residence in some else catchment area than Oulu university  hospital
             or Tampere university hospital

          -  Patient's understanding or co-operation inadequate

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Different Non-operative Treatment Protocols of ER-stress Negative Weber-B Unimalleolar Ankle Fractures. A Prospective Randomized Multicenter Trial.

overall_contact_backup.last_name: Tero Heikki Juhana Heikki Kortekangas, MD
